eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Lim98SE
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provide two behaviors:

- Turn object into cursor
Make the object as the new cursor

- Clickable button 
Provide a new condition on the object for fast checking is this one has been clicked.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: MouseHelper
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_mouse_wireless.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Check if a sprite has been clicked and turn any objects into a cursor.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Turns any object into a button, useful to know if it has been clicked with a simple object condition.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: button

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is clicked.

parameters.description: The name of the timer to loop

parameters.description: The time in seconds between each trigger

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Can be used to create enemies, NPCs, environmental objects, etc.

How to use:
- Add this behavior to an object
- Place spawners on the scene 
- Run the "Spawn objects" action on every frame
- Control spawning by adjusting behavior properties

Properties:
Spawn period:  Number of seconds before spawning another object.
Max quantity:  Each spawner will try to maintain this number of spawned objects
Offset X/Y:  Use to adjust where the object are spawned, relative to the origin of the spawner

Tips:
- Use "Object was just spawned" condition to trigger visual and sound effects (if desired)
- Set max quantity to "0" to never stop spawning objects
- Spawned objects are automatically linked to the spawner
- Note:  If max quantity has been reached and an instance is deleted, the spawner will wait the duration of spawn period before creating another instance.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectSpawner

eventsFunctions.description: Spawn (create) objects periodically.
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Periodically spawn (create) a _PARAM2_ located at spawner _PARAM0_

events.comment: Always spawn objects if quantity is set to "0"
Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached
This is used so that objects are not immediately spawned after deleting an instance after max instances had been reached
Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached
Spawn an object when conditions are met
Note: Spawned objects are linked to the spawner to check their number per spawner

eventsFunctions.description: Change the offset X relative to origin of spawner (in pixels).

eventsFunctions.description: Change the maximum number of living objects a spawner can create.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxQuantity
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the max quantity of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the spawn period (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SetSpawnPeriod
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the spawn period of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Return the offset X relative to origin of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: OffsetX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the offset Y relative to origin of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: OffsetY

eventsFunctions.description: Return the maximum number of living objects a spawner can create.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxQuantity

eventsFunctions.description: Return the spawn period (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnPeriod

eventsFunctions.description: Restart the cool down of a spawner.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetSpawnTimer

eventsFunctions.description: Return the remaining time before the next spawn (in seconds). Useful for triggering visual and sound effects.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Manage life points by damaging or healing the object.
Use damage cooldown to prevent further damage during the cooldown. 

Properties:
- Health
- Max Health
- Damage Cooldown (seconds)

Conditions:
- Is dead (no health points)
- Is just damaged

Actions:
- Damage the object (reduce health)
- Heal the object (increase health)
- Set current health
- Set maximum health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage life points by damaging or healing the object.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage life points by damaging or healing the object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object, decreasing its life points.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit

parameters.description: Value of the damage to do (will be removed from object health)
parameters.name: DamageValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is considered dead (no health points).
eventsFunctions.name: IsDead

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDamaged

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object, increasing its life points.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

parameters.description: How much to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object maximum health.
eventsFunctions.name: SetMaxHealth

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object health.
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth

eventsFunctions.description: The health of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Maximum health of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: MaxHealth

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage cooldown (in seconds) (0 for no cooldown)
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageCooldown

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: StayOnScreen
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Force the object to stay visible on the screen by setting back its position inside the viewport of the camera.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: StayOnScreen

parameters: min(max(Object.X(), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 + Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginLeft()), CameraX(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraWidth(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Width() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginRight())

min(max(Object.Y(), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) - CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2+ Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginTop()), CameraY(Object.Layer(), 0) + CameraHeight(Object.Layer(), 0)/2 - Object.Height() - Object.Behavior::PropertyMarginBottom())
